block.p: NBC's advertising sales for the Summer Olympics in Sydney, Australia, have exceeded its $780 million sales target and are expected to provide the network with a profit.

NBC's advertising sales for the Summer Olympics in Sydney, Australia, have exceeded its $780 million sales target and are expected to provide the network with a profit.
''We're still selling and expect to close out at $900 million,'' said Dick Ebersol, chairman of NBC Sports.
NBC is paying $705 million for the rights to carry the Sydney Games in September. In 1996, NBC paid $456 million for the Atlanta Summer Olympics and generated $680 million in ad sales.
NBC must cope with a 15-hour time difference from Sydney to the eastern time zone; the prime-time host Bob Costas will say during the first three evenings that everything will be carried on tape.
